result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

Defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jazmine Denise Hardman.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jazmine Denise Hardman.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Flynn requests a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9.2.22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jazmine Denise Hardman.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant could not appear as they entered a treatment program. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davila. Br. 1. 
Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - received and filed
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for pretrial conference and bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $100.00. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
TL
Officer J. Ravely, except in official MPD capacity 
TJ
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jazmine Denise Hardman in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jazmine Denise Hardman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter and nature of charges, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
